verses.kjv: The word of the LORD which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles;
verses.ct: This is the message from the LORD that came to the prophet Jeremiah concerning the nations:

verses.kjv: Against Egypt, against the army of Pharaohnecho king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.
verses.ct: Regarding Egypt — specifically the army of Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt, which was stationed at Carchemish along the Euphrates River, and which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon defeated in the 4th year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:

verses.kjv: Order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
verses.ct: "Get your small and large shields ready, and advance into battle!

verses.kjv: Harness the horses; and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, and put on the brigandines.
verses.ct: Saddle up the horses! Mount up, cavalry! Take your positions with helmets on! Sharpen your spears and put on your armor!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore have I seen them dismayed and turned away back? and their mighty ones are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not back: for fear was round about, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Why do I see them terrified and retreating? Their warriors are crushed, running away at full speed without looking back. Terror surrounds them on every side, says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape; they shall stumble, and fall toward the north by the river Euphrates.
verses.ct: The fast runner cannot outrun it, and the strong warrior cannot escape. In the north, along the Euphrates River, they will trip and collapse.

verses.kjv: Who is this that cometh up as a flood, whose waters are moved as the rivers?
verses.ct: Who is this rising like the Nile in flood, with waters churning like rushing rivers?

verses.kjv: Egypt riseth up like a flood, and his waters are moved like the rivers; and he saith, I will go up, and will cover the earth; I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.ct: Egypt rises like the Nile in flood, its waters surging like rivers. Egypt says, "I will rise up and cover the land! I will destroy cities and everyone living in them!"

verses.kjv: Come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighty men come forth; the Ethiopians and the Libyans, that handle the shield; and the Lydians, that handle and bend the bow.
verses.ct: Charge forward, horses! Drive furiously, chariots! Let the warriors advance — soldiers from Ethiopia and Libya carrying shields, and archers from Lydia drawing their bows!

verses.kjv: For this is the day of the Lord GOD of hosts, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge him of his adversaries: and the sword shall devour, and it shall be satiate and made drunk with their blood: for the Lord GOD of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.
verses.ct: But this day belongs to the Lord GOD of hosts — a day of payback when he settles accounts with his enemies. The sword will consume until it has had its fill, gorged on their blood. The Lord GOD of hosts has a sacrifice to make in the northern land along the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of Egypt: in vain shalt thou use many medicines; for thou shalt not be cured.
verses.ct: Go up to Gilead and find healing ointment, young daughter of Egypt! But no matter how many remedies you try, it will be useless — there is no healing for you.

verses.kjv: The nations have heard of thy shame, and thy cry hath filled the land: for the mighty man hath stumbled against the mighty, and they are fallen both together.
verses.ct: The nations have heard about your disgrace, and your cries of anguish have echoed across the land. Warrior has tripped over warrior, and they have gone down together.

verses.kjv: The word that the LORD spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: This is the message the LORD spoke to the prophet Jeremiah about how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon would come and attack the land of Egypt:

verses.kjv: Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol, and publish in Noph and in Tahpanhes: say ye, Stand fast, and prepare thee; for the sword shall devour round about thee.
verses.ct: "Announce it in Egypt! Proclaim it in Migdol! Proclaim it in Memphis and Tahpanhes! Say: Take your positions and get ready, because the sword is devouring everything around you!"

verses.kjv: Why are thy valiant men swept away? they stood not, because the LORD did drive them.
verses.ct: Why have your mighty warriors been swept away? They could not stand their ground because the LORD drove them down.

verses.kjv: He made many to fall, yea, one fell upon another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our nativity, from the oppressing sword.
verses.ct: He made many of them stumble; they fell over each other. They said, "Get up! Let's go back to our own people and our homeland, away from this deadly sword!"

verses.kjv: They did cry there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he hath passed the time appointed.
verses.ct: There they shouted, "Pharaoh king of Egypt is nothing but hot air — he missed his moment!"

verses.kjv: As I live, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, Surely as Tabor is among the mountains, and as Carmel by the sea, so shall he come.
verses.ct: "As surely as I live," declares the King whose name is the LORD of hosts, "one will come who stands out like Tabor among the mountains, like Carmel rising above the sea."

verses.kjv: O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity: for Noph shall be waste and desolate without an inhabitant.
verses.ct: Pack your bags for exile, you who live in Egypt! Memphis will become a wasteland, burned and deserted, with no one living there.

verses.kjv: Egypt is like a very fair heifer, but destruction cometh; it cometh out of the north.
verses.ct: Egypt is like a beautiful young cow, but a stinging fly is coming — it is coming from the north.

verses.kjv: Also her hired men are in the midst of her like fatted bullocks; for they also are turned back, and are fled away together: they did not stand, because the day of their calamity was come upon them, and the time of their visitation.
verses.ct: Even her hired soldiers among her are like fattened calves. They too have turned around and fled together. They could not hold their ground because their day of disaster had arrived — the time of their punishment.

verses.kjv: The voice thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewers of wood.
verses.ct: Egypt will hiss like a retreating snake as the enemy marches forward with military force. They will come at her with axes, like woodcutters chopping trees.

verses.kjv: They shall cut down her forest, saith the LORD, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the grasshoppers, and are innumerable.
verses.ct: They will chop down her forest, declares the LORD, even though it seems impenetrable. They outnumber locusts — there is no counting them.

verses.kjv: The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded; she shall be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.
verses.ct: The daughter of Egypt will be humiliated; she will be handed over to the people from the north.

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, saith; Behold, I will punish the multitude of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with their gods, and their kings; even Pharaoh, and all them that trust in him:
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "Pay attention — I am going to punish Amon, the god of Thebes, along with Pharaoh, Egypt, her gods, and her kings — Pharaoh and everyone who relies on him.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants: and afterward it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I will hand them over to those who want them dead — to Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and his officials. But afterward, Egypt will be inhabited again as it was in ancient times," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But fear not thou, O my servant Jacob, and be not dismayed, O Israel: for, behold, I will save thee from afar off, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and be in rest and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.
verses.ct: "But don't be afraid, my servant Jacob, and don't be discouraged, Israel. Look — I am going to rescue you from far away, and your descendants from the land where they are captive. Jacob will return and live in peace and security, and no one will frighten him.

verses.kjv: Fear thou not, O Jacob my servant, saith the LORD: for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but correct thee in measure; yet will I not leave thee wholly unpunished.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, Jacob my servant," declares the LORD, "because I am with you. I will completely destroy every nation where I have scattered you, but I will not completely destroy you. I will discipline you fairly — but I certainly will not let you go entirely unpunished."
